en.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "a" and "kin" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms.
en.definition: (interjection) ah, oh, ha, eh, um, oy; (particle) [placed after something for emphasis or emotion]
en.sp_etymology: exclamation radical + Latin lowercase letter A; radical from exclamation point (!), without the full stop at the bottom. compare o

en.sp_etymology: animal radical; pictogram of a lizard. radical represents eyes

en.sp_etymology: pictogram of a bow and an arrow

pu_verbatim.en:
ADJECTIVE all; abundant, countless, bountiful, every, plentiful
NOUN abundance, everything, life, universe
NUMBER 100
pu_verbatim.fr:
ADJECTIF tous, abondants, innombrables
NOM tout, abondance, la vie, l'univers
NOMBRE 100
pu_verbatim.de:
ADJEKTIV alle, jede/r/s; im Überfluss, zahllos, reichlich
NOMEN Überfluss, alles, Leben, Universum
ZAHL 100
pu_verbatim.eo:
ADJEKTIVO ĉiuj; abunda, nenombrebla, ĉiu
SUBSTANTIVO abundo, ĉio, vivo, universo
NOMBRO 100

en.commentary:
"ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" remains more common.
The majority of speakers report not understanding the "abundant, bountiful, plentiful" meaning, at least out of context.
"20, 120" were non-pu meanings previously in use in the community alongside 100; they are virtually unheard of nowadays.
en.definition: all, every, everything, entirety, universe; (number) one hundred
en.sp_etymology: infinity symbol (∞)

en.commentary: "ali" is an alternative to "ale", coined in a poll in 2002 in order to avoid confusion with "ala". However, the usage of "ale" over "ali" has been more common since at least the release of pu. Generally not considered a word in its own right.
en.definition: [pronunciation variant of ale]
en.sp_etymology: infinity symbol (∞)

en.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "anpa" has the meaning of "place that is down". In pu, "noka" has that meaning instead.
en.definition: bottom, underside; below, beneath; defeated, humble, lowly
en.sp_etymology: location radical + "container"; the latter perhaps from a truncated square for a general object (compare sinpin) or a container (compare poki). for the radical, see also how dots are used in blissymbols; compare blissymbol "below"

apeja.author_verbatim: - to single out - expose ; to reveale the guilt or wrongdoing of - to attack non-physically (verbally attack) - to expose to shame blame to fault accuse to cause to feel shame to dishonour, disgrace a painful emotion resulting from an awareness of having done something dishonourable, unworthy, degrading, etc.
creator: jan Sonja

en.commentary: According to jan Sonja, "apeja" never appeared in any pre-pu toki pona dictionary made by her and never promoted by her, instead it may have been "just an experimental idea in a forum post".

en.commentary: There are various analyses of the syntactic role of "en". Originally intended to be used as "and", it was changed (via poll in 2002) to just be used with "head nouns". One of the more recent analyses (including 2021's April Fools) treats "en" as a subject marker.
en.definition: (particle) [separates multiple subjects]
en.sp_etymology: from plus sign (+); compare blissymbol “and”.

en.definition: epic, cool, awesome, amazing

en.commentary: In common usage (both before and after pu), "lukin" and "oko" are separate words, each with their own meaning. In pu, they are considered synonyms. Those who consider them synonyms typically don't use "oko" at all, preferring "lukin" in all circumstances. The usage of "alasa" as a preverb meaning "try to" is more common than "lukin". In pu, only "lukin" has this meaning. A very common beginner mistake is treating "lukin" as if it means "appearance", due to the mistakenly equating the "visual" meaning as in "pona lukin (visually good)" to mean "looks good".

en.sp_etymology: pictogram of an eye. compare blissymbol “eye”

sutopatikuna.author_verbatim: Dear Sonja, That's a great idea, but if you do so, you need also to add a special word forthe Platypus (Ornithorhynchus anatinus). I would suggest the word "sutopatikuna"from the croatian word Èudnovati kljuna¹. Bonega ideo, sed se vi farus tion, vi devus ankaux aldoni apartan vorton porla Ornitorinko (Ornithorhynchus anatinus). Mi proponus la vorton "sutopatikuna"prenita de la kroatan vorton Èudnovati kljuna¹.:P
creator: Alexandre Baudry
